title: How to convert a charity into a charitable company or CIO

details.body:
As your charity grows, you may need to change its structure so it can meet its purposes.

Advantages of being a company or CIO

The law considers a company to have the same legal status as a person. This means your charity can employ staff, own land or enter into contracts in its own name.

Compared with an unincorporated association or trust, trustees of a charitable company or CIO are less likely to be personally liable for its debts or legal action brought against it.

Make the right decision

Before you convert to a CIO, agree that this is the best option. Read the Charity Commission’s guidance on decision making.

Convert to a charitable company

Step one: set up and register a new company with Companies House:

Starting a new company – Companies House

Step two: register your new company with the commission as a charity:

Setting up a charity

Step three: transfer your original charity’s assets to your new company charity, for example by a merger.

Before transferring assets

Make sure your original charity has no outstanding debts or liabilities it needs to pay

Step four: decide whether to close your original, unincorporated charity, keep it as a linked charity or register a merger.

How to close a charity

How to merge or link charities

Notify the commission of a charity merger

You should follow any rules in your charity’s governing document - the commission recommends you take legal advice where necessary. Read the commission’s detailed guidance for more information on becoming a company charity:

Incorporating an existing charity as a company

PDF, 796KB, 21 pages

This file may not be suitable for users of assistive technology. Request an accessible format.

If you use assistive technology (eg a screen reader) and need a version of this document in a more accessible format, please email usability@charitycommission.gsi.gov.uk. Please tell us what format you need. It will help us if you say what assistive technology you use.

Converting into a CIO

Step one: set up and register the new CIO with the commission. Use one of the commission’s model constitutions as your governing document:

Setting rules for your charity: governing documents

Step two: transfer your original charity’s assets to the new CIO, making sure you settle any debts first.

Step three: close your original charity - in line with any rules set out in its governing document - and notify the commission of this:

How to close a charity

Converting a charitable company to a CIO

You can’t currently convert a charitable company into a CIO.
